result.rationale: This species is considered as Endangered according to the B1ab(iii) criteria: the extent of occurrence (EOO) is estimated to be less than 5,000 km<sup>2</sup> (576 km<sup>2</sup>), it is known to exist at no more than five locations (one), and there is a continuing decline in the area, extent and quality of habitat due to deforestation and crops implantation in the area.
result.geographicrange: This species is known from a small creek, Arroyo El Oculto, tributary of the Blanco River (Mirande et al. 2004) and another small creek affluent to the Bermejo River, both part of the Bermejo River basin (F. Alonso et al. pers. obs. 2020).
result.population: There are no data available on the population trend of this species.
result.habitat: This species inhabits small creeks with clear water and slow flow with marginal vegetation being rare or not present in other aquatic environments of the area that, in contrast, present regular flooding and murky waters in summer (Mirande et al. 2004, F. Alonso et al. pers. obs. 2020).
result.threats: The distribution area of this species has been intensively affected by deforestation and crops implantation that could affect the quality and extent of the habitat of this species, increasing sediments and changing the flow regime. Also the use of agro-chemicals in the crops may be affecting the species.
result.conservationmeasures: Part of the population of this species is in a private reserve.
result.usetrade: There are no known uses of this species but other similar small species in the area are occasionally used as bait and so it is likely that this species might be used as bait occasionally too.
